title: Deontay Wilder accuses Tyson Fury of ‘lying’ about WWE purse
text:
Wilder and Fury are set for a rematch in Getty Images)

Deontay Wilder has accused Tyson Fury of lying about earning $15million (£11.9m) for his WWE bout with Braun Strowman this month and believes the figure is heavily inflated.

It has been reported that Fury – who is due to face off with his heavyweight rival again in February – will take home a huge wedge of cash home from his performance in Saudi Arabia on October 31 but Wilder is questioning the figures that have been fed to the press by Fury’s team.

‘I wish everyone well, especially fighters,’ Wilder told The Sun. ‘We work so hard and put our lives on the line so whatever outside of boxing come to us I’m happy for everyone.

Wilder and Fury are set to return to the ring together (Picture: Getty)

‘I’m into acting, my thing is acting. I’ve been doing my thing, super busy, I got a lot of acting stuff, movies, a lot of s*** presented to me.

‘But I’ve been hearing some bits about the WWE. You know, some of the stuff I just don’t believe – like the $15million.

‘I just can’t see them giving Fury $15m for what is a guest appearance, when the highest paid I believe is Brock Lesnar on $12m.

‘Why would they give that to a guy that can’t even sell out Vegas?

‘In his first fight he sold 1,500 tickets, and the second he sold 3,500 tickets the rest he gave away, why would they give someone $15m after that?

‘It’s just like the ESPN deal, that was a lie. He was never getting $100m, even his promoter Bob Arum came out and said that’s not true, if everything goes perfect then maybe he get a $100m.

‘A lot of it is smoking mirrors and clout chasing.’
